alert.note: Alert for Clark; Edwards; Ford; Hodgeman; Kiowa; Ness; Pawnee; Rush (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 10:29PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Ford, western Kiowa, southeastern Ness, eastern Hodgeman, Pawnee, southwestern Rush, Edwards and northeastern Clark Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1029 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near McCracken to near Gray to near Dodge City. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Gray and Burdett around 1035 PM CDT. Ft. Dodge and Wright around 1045 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Kinsley, La Crosse, Ford and Rush Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central, central, southwestern and west central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Edwards; Ford; Hodgeman; Kiowa; Ness; Pawnee; Rush
